intro: Pauridiantha principensis, commonly known as the Principes pauridiantha, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary tropical forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of great interest to botanists and conservationists.
